69wlXFj8hnbUiIrIBJhSGA.text: The food was amazing, very flavorful! Excellent service and the owner was extremely humorous & fun! A lil pricey but so worth it! Definitely going back!!

k3j6vE-YB23FRUGKOHTwJw.text: Not worth the money.  We got takeout.  $70 barely feeds 2 people. Rice and naan were ala cart.  Do yourself a favor- go to Tandori Times and sit at the bar and enjoy the belly dancing and sword dancing.

klTDnuN81WUe3ibUUCw_8Q.text: Just OK. Not much to write home about.  Quite expensive for what I consider to be average Indian cuisine.  I have had truly excellent Northern Indian (Punjabi style) food in West and East Coast and in the UK and this ain't it.  I thought the Rainta was watery and tasteless, the Lamb Paneer was skimpy with actual lamb, and the Naan bread looked suspiciously "pre-made"...perhaps frozen and then baked?  It just did not have the 'off the Tandoor" burn marks and stretched look one would expect to see for Naan costing around $6.00 per serving.  That said, the waitress was sweet and attentive and the place looks nice.  It's just overpriced for what is an average curry shop.

MhOlKmABF6eI2dKfMaCdEg.text: Just ordered takeout. Disappointed. Garlic naan was 1/4 the size of other well known established restaurants around.   Absolutely no rice included!!!!  So I'm making my own. Disappointed again. So far the main dishes are great but the extras are severely lacking. Spent $55 and not happy. Hope the owner sees this and rectifies the situation.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lacking quantity big time compared to other well know great Indian places. And no rice with dishes!!

W27HtwnisgmbWycct-stxA.text: Found this restaurant on yelp since I was in the area. It's Ina great location in old town. Nice restaurant to walk into w a fairly large space. Have a full bar as well. Owner is friendly and was walking around talk to everyone and also taking orders.   We ordered a few different items, chicken tikka masala, biriyani, tandoori chicken and naan per his recommendations. Unfortunately the food was not very good. The lassi was made well. The food portions were definitely on the smaller side especially for the price. It was also not spiced very well and did not feel very authentic.  Will likely not return here for Indian food as there are better options in the Valley.

YEHtVcdE2xz0IxomYG3MaA.text: As an appetizer, I got the Vegetarian Platter: Onion Bhaji, Veggie Pakora, & 2 Vegetable Samosas - $12.  I really enjoyed the Onion Bhaji & Veggie Pakora; both were perfectly seasoned and delicious. The Vegetable Samosas were good, but I wasn't a fan of their tamarind sauce, at all. It was way too tart and had no hint of the sweetness that I like in my tamarind sauces.    My main entree was the vegan Aloo Saag -$14, which I ordered spicy/hot.  It was ok, but it was too dry and it had zero spice.  I have had delicious vegan Aloo Saag at other restaurants, so they cannot use the excuse that the lack of cream is the culprit. I have no idea where the spice went, but none of it went into my dish.  I was very disappointed, and it was certainly not worth $14.  I was told that the only vegan bread options were the roti and the Aloo Pratha. I don't like roti so I got the Aloo Pratha -$5.  The bread was hard (too difficult to cut) and not tasty.   My lunchmate had the non-vegan Aloo Saag and some naan. She stated that her naan was also hard and she was not happy with her Aloo Saag either.   I had issues with their cleanliness. When we arrived at the dinner opening time, we were the first ones there.  The benches had not been cleaned or wiped down from the lunch crowd (which was about 3 hours earlier). I had to ask the waiter to wipe the seats. Also, there was some sort of food in my water glass. I had to ask for a new glass. Lastly, I saw a guy get hired immediately after about a 2 minute interview, which was cool. It was not cool to see him immediately start waiting tables and he was holding one tables' water glasses against his shirt! I think the manager said something because the new guy then placed the already tainted glasses on a tray.   The prices were too high for the quality (of food & service) and amount of food that you get. It is unlikely that I will re-visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Definitely not worth these prices.
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Something in the water
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Aloo Pratha (front), Naan (rear) - Bread was hard

L6eMAo0Xj_PcqLvw8hHMaQ.text: I love those mango lassi drinks, but I know not to order one before my meal, as the drink is a meal in itself, at least for me. However, Mark H. was along and ordered one and then was freely sharing it. Yep, I was licking the cup before our food arrived, at least I didn't order it AND I didn't drink the whole lassi!   Garlic naan is a must-have. The bullet naan is a welcome change, but I definitely preferred the garlic.  The lentil dish had quite the spice kick to it, ordered medium. It paired nicely with the naan.  Lamb vindaloo had great flavor and at the medium spice level was a little lower on the spice scale from others that I've had. Tasted great though.  Butter chicken was the surprise for me. Very flavorful. I had seconds on that, or maybe even thirds.   The vegetable korma was the fourth dish. Perfect pairing to the butter chicken.  The staff was excellent, and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. No room for dessert sadly, but I did have that mango lassi!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb vindaloo, butter chicken, lentil dish and something else. John B. ordered and we did family-style.
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rESCARbpllVsVBcgNZuYEA.text: Best Chicken Tikka Masala in town. Great environment and friendly staff. If you have a gluten free person in your group they will also be pleasantly surprised by their options. Parking is also great as they have a back door entrance right next to the Old Town parking garage. Will be going back tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar in Taj Mahal

nNmEcylKOxwH8jXb_UECcw.text: I came here for lunch buffet one time and was not impressed but tried it again and ordered from the menu. We had several dishes and shared family style. It all hit the spot with very good flavors. My favorite was the Tika, the chicken curry was pretty good as well. We also had butter chicken and makani, they were good as well. The lamb Vindaloo was good but I would have liked the potatoes and the lamb to be more done. Otherwise would have given them 5 stars. The service was good.  The atmosphere is nice and the noise is medium. Definitely passes the come again test

4Mw6XJsgW2EN7K6Y3rjYXQ.text: While walking through the Scottsdale area, we stopped here for a late bite to eat - without looking at Yelp! But I was in for a pleasant surprise! We ordered the Lamb Masala, Medium rice and Rosemary Naan. Everything was delicious! The flavors were amazing and the service was great.  The only downside is I don't live in the Phoenix area so I won't be able to eat there soon. I can still dream about it though :0)

JWksf-fxHW-EFilNflzPgA.text: We have eaten here several times and have always had great meals.  This time we took friends: one couple who love Indian food and another couple who had never eaten Indian food.  Everyone agreed the food was great.  The samosas and pakora were the best our Indian food loving friends had ever had.  We had butter shrimp, lamb vindaloo, and chicken tikka masala.

5OkuU9i4UJwBQ9y2VX4CYw.text: Came here with a group of friends the other night and everyone enjoyed dinner.  They serve Indian beer here. Not sure what to think of it, I had a glass just because it was there. Not much of light beer type but glad I got to try once.  Vegetable samosa was very good. I really liked the sauce came with it. I set it aside to eat with rice later as they were that good.  For dinner, we shared three different curry. My favorite was lamb korma. I tend to order lamb korma at every Indian restaurant as I know that's one dish seemed to be always consistent and I know I will enjoy. I don't have much experience with Indian food, so I try something new every time. This time was egg plant vegetable curry. It didn't have that of good flavor for me, they were okay, I probably won't order it again. Fish curry on the other hand was good. Not as good as lamb but curry had nice flavor to it, I wouldn't mind trying it again.  Service was very friendly. It was a slow weekday night. Owner came over to talk to us often and he was really funny. Service was prompt. Nice decor and ambiance, it was a good experience for me.

hJJe6YZaDKT6wbwrtkGrmA.text: First of all the owner is HILARIOUS !! My Punjabi boyfriend really enjoyed his talk with the owner they really created a bromance LOL!! But honestly the food is to die for! I'm originally from New York City and we've had a handful of Indian food in our lifetime and I will definitely say this  has made my list of top 5!

jzxahQR0r4Oz1146CUPCXA.text: This restaurant is a True gem in the heart of old town.  The portions are perfect and their lunch specials during the week are fantastic.  If you want to taste some authentic Indian cuisine you must try it.

NOECe25Plx5SPeTzj8p7sw.text: Best Indian food in town hands down never had a bad  experience  The owner gill is super nice will come up and greet you at the table

bId5njVTQVAawmx8Gz9ewQ.text: Really loved this place! Good ambiance and super friendly owner, very passionate about his restaurant! Loved the Chicken dishes, and very sweet complimentary desert he gave our table because they had just opened and were doing a promotion!  Only thing missing a full five stars.... small portion sizes at least for the rice especially!! It's one thing that it doesn't come with the meal but at least serve it in a bigger size.  Overall amazing food, location and service :)

UXguYoLwX5hQrH0VZxdKeQ.text: Such great Indian food. I got coconut chicken and my girlfriend got vegetable curry. Perfect amount of spice, great service and the food was amazing. They also gave us a 20% off coupon for next time!

EJgfuLR2LEhni15ywBaiBA.text: Came here on a Saturday at about 11:35 ( they opened at 11:30). Two gentlemen inside...asked if the were open and one guy said yes. He then approached us and sat us down. Did the full step by step waiter obvious. We ordered our food and he even suggested appetizers. Waited about 30 mins and he says Sorry to inform you guys but our cook is running late ...we're going to give a free appetizer while you wait cause he will be here shortly...20 mins later we ask if the cook is here he says almost. 50 mins later we decided to leave.

UGXJLnsSmQLT6vzgpVp1Mw.text: Great, Had the yellow Lentil soup and Chicken Khorma, some of the best I've ever had.  Owner takes pride in his food and the place it shows.

wJ5P3VOngVpTSLm3XgV5iw.text: This place has great food and great service. Happy that they opened up this Scottsdale location. Much closer.

eElp-2-ODPOK2-0brTx7ow.text: No pictures on this comment because we ate it all too fast. It was DELICIOUS! The lentil soup tasted very fresh and the Chicken Tikka Masala sauce was addictive. The owner Gil and server were very welcoming and amicable. We will definitely return and will make it one of our "go to" places to eat!

5NRVmT0WSFVjIcaPeqX21Q.text: This is our go to Indian place in Old Town. Close to everything. Great ambiance, drink menu, and ambiance! Very friendly staff and delicious food!

ligrKFzKMlaJQ91LFxQ7yQ.text: Vegetable masara was good!! It was best curry I have ate.

mGV1GVcvM4BueBz_qoNZOg.text: Wow! I love this place! I've been searching for good Indian cuisine in Arizona for some time now. I'm originally from NYC and feel like I'm a connoisseur if Indian cuisine. I've finally found it at Taj Mahal. The food is awesome. It is seasoned just right and an explosion of flavors for your palate. I've been eating mostly vegetarian and they had numerous vegetarian and vegan options on the menu. I really look forward to returning and trying more dishes. The added bonuses are the atmosphere and the service. The restaurant has a great and cozy decor that is clean and welcoming. Most importantly was the service. Our server Sandra was awesome! She was super friendly and attentive! The owner, Gil, is a great guy as well! He has super positive energy! He visits ever table to make sure you're satisfied and just has an infectious upbeat happy energy that rubs off! I will definitely be returning soon!

4NM5MKlPOa4Y5X9hWlFZIw.text: Oh My Goodness!!  Dinner here tonight was Amazing! The owner (Gil) made the evening Fabulous and SO entertaining...The place is a little get away that has Awesome Indian food in Old Town Scottsdale! I had the Pakora Masala which was great and the Garlic Naan was delicious...If you haven't tried Indian food or want a new place to dine this is it!

4dnE8GmYPmpuzl4JLmXvzw.text: Amazing! So authentic. Gill, the owner was so friendly and the food... Best in Maricopa county! You must try it!!

TDYenCpuP5zS20hd9yEgEw.text: My tikka masala was good but the naan was burnt and didn't taste that great. The lamb rice was not very tasty at all (you would think for $20 dollars for rice it would at least have some flavor). Customer service was good when I could actually get it. They were short staff when we came in but they tried their best. I would definitely try another Indian restaurant before considering to ever go here again.

o_lttckiB3pFJRv2-dXScw.text: Great samosa , and quality North Indian Punjabi style restaurant. Host is very Friendly! New find on the Indian restaurant radar and definitely worth the visit

XqE9QLENuNK8h2hOJkLDNQ.text: Went for dinner tonight. Absolutely the best Indian food we've had in Arizona. Chicken Tikka masala was amazing as was the saag paneer and garlic naan. Owner Gil is also extremely friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be regulars here.

u3FaCOgs5eiBP8aV1U3k3A.text: My favorite Indian food so far in AZ. The butter chicken is amazing and my fiance loves their other entrees. Convenient location. Chicken tikka masala and chicken Vindaloo are also good. It is a little expensive but it is my go to for Indian food in the valley. They will substitute white chicken for dark meat if you request.

inaCGuUrLbqqcs9QEdB9Ng.text: Food is decent. Little costly for Indian restaurant. Owner talks too much.. some times that is irritating. Been here two times, owner shared same jokes evey time.

zV9qKkP-m1hligZHJVVGxA.text: Great food, ambiance, and friendly staff. First place we came when visiting and will be back!

fUjpDH7IcbjtXNFjgbxfNw.text: This is not my first rodeo when it comes to Indian food and I will tell you this, if you don't come here your missing the boat. The owner is the most delightful personality the service is hand and foot and the food is exceptional. The prices are reasonable and the place is immaculate and the atmosphere is modern with a touch of India. Please bring them your business!   Namaste!

zt-nOA6Z10J9JEqzCjw5QA.text: Fantastic food, attentive and knowledgeable waitstaff who gave perfect recommendations. Delicious!

IK-cCkSDyCue69LyTZjgTg.text: So incredibly delicious! My friends and I ordered the naan basket with the raita yogurt for starters. The onion naan was my favorite. For the entrees we did the paneer masala, chicken tikka, coconut chicken and the basmati rice. The flavors were incredible and the service was wonderful! We were so full by the end of the meal but we couldn't stop eating. The vibe inside was great and we will definitely be back!!! Do yourself a favor and check this place out!

utG6HjVpU-uPNXPX5ZTTrg.text: Place was deserted at 8:00 on a Wed night. This made us nervous that the food might not be great, but we trusted in our fellow Yelpers, and we were not disappointed.   Food tasted hot and fresh. Butter chicken, veg korma, saag paneer, chicken coconut, lentil soup, garlic naan--all were delish.   The ambience was a bit odd. Loud Bollywood music videos playing, loud buzzing appliance, no music. But the staff were really attentive and friendly.   Would definitely come back.

MFgKm-1e-MGGOI4dM6Pqlg.text: My husband and I have always love their location in Prescott and were so excited to hear they opened one one in the valley. This location is just as good, but maybe even better because it's so close. They have a large section of vegan and vegetarian dishes here, all of which are some of the most incredible Indian dishes I've ever had. The owner and staff is knowledgeable about the food which is important because we have some dietary restrictions. They are also happy to make a custom dish if we ask for something to be added/ removed. We have never had a poor experience with this restaurant and will continue to go to both locations for some great Indian food. Enjoy!

ZZlyRI10bN-fuf6rNx3r1g.text: First time visitor. I have tried many indian restaurants and food here was not up to the standard. Quantity was also very less compared to other indian restaurants. The owner was very unprofessional, when I asked him do they serve complementary rice with chicken items as other restaurants do, he started asking which restaurants and other questions. Also he was not very polite and I didn't like his behavior. I asked for onions with nan and the waiter said even that is chargeable. I may not return there.

sB7YDY-nZIHchqYDb0vUqw.text: The worst example of Indian food, ever. We ordered the Chicken Tikka masala (their specialty), aloo gobi, and tandoori chicken. The tandoori chicken was flavorless and the meat hard, the accompanying onions soggy. The chicken tikka masala got all it's taste from the cream and the aloo gobi was a soggy letdown, flavorless and miserable! In short, a disastrous experience and a traversety of Indian food.

NePO4HM8HXvi8s6mDeDHeQ.text: Best Indian food in the valley! Loads of yummy vegan options which is very appreciated. The portion sizes are perfect. The service is awesome and so friendly. The owner is the warmest most hospitable man. He and the server remember us every time we come in. You feel like family. First discovered Taj Mahal at their Prescott location and were super excited to find out they have a Scottsdale location. Excited to come back!

0vh2uTok3J4Aur4HyvH7Fw.text: This is a second location to Gill's Prescott, Arizona one. I have loved Indian food for over 20 years and this is the tastiest anywhere!! The buttery and creamy Chicken Tikka Masala is on point although ad a little heat and it makes it that much better. You can not find more fun hosts and great crowds as well. I highly recommend you try the food here Scottsdale!

44WyrXhTSjcH6mREycB0XQ.text: Definite 5 stars.  The flavor, delivery, service, and environment are all on point.  We got the saag paneer and the chicken tikka masala, both fantastic. The saag was the best I have ever had.  I will be coming back.

R8LGU9m9nZCop0ZVZE8yGQ.text: I've been coming to Taj Mahal for a decade. How is that possible, you ask? They started out in Prescott with their first location and now I'm eating at the Scottsdale digs for the first time. It tastes amazing! Garlic Naan and Chicken Tikka Masala are a must! Don't think. Just come out here!! Also, drink a Taj Mahal beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Curry

Ph2pY4JQj5eRagFRzHmJ8A.text: Definitely the best Indian food my wife and I have tried here in Scottsdale. This is a new establishment so still working through some kinks service and bar wise but the food was outstanding.   Gil, the owner, has another outstanding Indian restaurant in Prescott and decided to start a restaurant here in Scottsdale, so glad he did! I have been to his restaurant in Prescott on two occasions when in town and was very impressed then so was surprised to learn of his newest venture while talking with him at the bar last night. His Prescott restaurant is located on Whiskey Row just southwest of the main town square and is huge.  We started with samosa's which were perfectly cooked and spiced along with flavorful sauces to accompany and also tried the mulligatawny soup which was very hardy and  delicious. Wife had chicken korma, son had curried goat and I tried mahi mahi vindaloo which was cooked perfectly with large chunks of moist fish in a spicy vindaloo sauce. Goat is always one of our favorite meals whenever dining and Taj Mahal did not disappoint with large pieces of tender fall off the bone goat in a flavorful curry. All sauces and spices were spot on inviting us to finish every morsel with the naan bread.  This is also a larger establishment located next to Dos Gringos with a full bar so please do yourself a favor and come down to the 5th Street corridor to try what we thought was definitely the best Indian food in the Valley. Enjoy!

wIJ546dz0VmX3p2ZHBAChA.text: Rich delicious sauces on lamb kofta and paneer marsala. Food and atmosphere great. Service a little unusual. Owner tends to yell at staff.

VeXynIyHOWpZNzGU-4-JZQ.text: Really good food portions were kind of small and prices were kind of high.  But it's quality over quantity unless your starving. I don't think they have lunch specials!

XaivJEUjMJR9pJd2PA95Hw.text: This place was freaking AWESOME! Everything we ordered was delicious and flavorful. If you're vegan and in Scottsdale this place is a must. Friendly service and their recommendations are on point. Will definitely come here again when I'm in the area!

hMp058C8B1epsN8oem3Sew.text: Horrible experience. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and got a chicken dish that looked yellow, more like a malai kofta than a tikka masala sauce. I ordered medium/hot and there was so little spice in it that it tasted like nothing. I then had to go up to the bar to tell the waiter we didn't get our naan after waiting for 5+ minutes after the rest of the food came. I also told the waiter the chicken tasted very very mild and she took it back to add more spices and came back to say the chef would just remake it. Okay fine by me. While I was waiting for the remade chicken the naan came out and it was raw! Had to send that back as well and it came out raw around the edges a second time. She said they have a new naan chef, but you think they would make sure he isn't making raw naan before putting him in the kitchen to make customer's food. The remade chicken was slightly more spicy but still in no way a medium/hot or even remotely looking like the RED chicken tikka masala sauce it was supposed to be.   After that whole ordeal I got the bill and I was charged for everything. I had to use a yelp coupon to get the naan taken off the bill. I have never had so many problems with my meal and not even been comped for the chai tea. My wife is Indian and I have eaten at plenty of great Indian restaurants and this is one of the worst experiences I have had at any Indian restaurant anywhere. The staff was friendly sure, but the food was horrible. We just moved here from New Jersey, where great Indian restaurants are aplenty. We will not be coming back to the Taj Mahal!

Di3n3dU6wQZMuVVk0ZDl4A.text: Tonight I had one of the best meals I've had in a really really long time at Taj Mahal. The owner Gill was so outgoing and kind and let me try different things. I ordered the lamb Boti masala and the Lamb Curry. Both were equally out of this world.  The home-made Nann (plain) bread was to die for.    I will definitely be back; maybe tomorrow.

5FEMu7tLO-8lnkA-nQNVzA.text: Tasty lamb vindaloo, tasty naan. They ran out of the IPA I was drinking and brought over two small samples of other suggestions, completely unprompted. Now that's service. Owner came out and said hi too!

jPYutaKMKfL8XD0GzWoe2A.text: The BEST chicken tikka masala! Sizable, delicious, chicken pieces and not fatty. I've also had their food delivered though amazon restaurants, and it's always a perfect order with great taste and great temperature. Can't wait to try more things on the menu!

-hZoUXPhsWs13eHH6mDPPA.text: Flavorful and authentic dishes. Cool atmosphere too! Had the garlic naan, roti, chicken bhuna and chana sag. Will be back to try more dishes.

yBcTzODlPoEK4u9s7tA1yQ.text: Our first visit was spectacular!  It was refreshing to have a waitstaff that was attentive to our specific allergy considerations.  The food itself was bursting with flavor.  Try the wings on the appetizer menu...they will not disappoint.  I paired my dinner with a Tajmopolitan mixed drink and it was superb.  Topped off the evening with their refreshing mango ice cream.  All-in-all a wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sacred geometry artwork lends a nice touch of atmosphere.

x0cEHmO1-dyD-CTacAKWIw.text: Went the first night to try it out for great Indian food. (Based on all the reviews.) MAN was it delicious! The atmosphere is really nice and pretty with a nice setup in the restaurant. The owner happened to be there and had a nice chat with us since there wasn't a lot of customers at the time. (Cusses like a sailor but humorous too!) He even gave us free desserts! The only downside of this restaurant is the portion sizes run about $16.99+ for a small bowl with rice. Their naan is also terrific (they have assorted naan too!) Overall, if you want delicious Indian, and don't mind the prices, then by all means! Would definitely come back here again!

S2wgtF2Z2LF4tqHQJRBoDQ.text: One would expect more of a tourist trap kind of place in the Old Town Scottsdale area, but Taj Mahal popped up on Yelp for me as a well rated restaurant for Indian food in the Phoenix area and it did not disappoint. I called up the place as it was after 9 pm and a cheerful gentleman answered the phone and said "come on in...the kitchen is open until 11," whereas other similar options for food had shut down for the evening or were winding down to close. Service by the guy behind the bar (could have been the manager) was attentive and friendly. The onion bhaji was spiced right and prepared well. For mains, we ordered the chicken tikka masala and saag paneer, with naan and rice. Both meals had great and well spiced gravies, and I appreciated the fact that they had several different levels of spice preparation for food. If it's one thing I would fault the business on is charging for rice and not including some complimentary with the main courses, but perhaps I am a bit spoiled by that being a standard back home in NJ. The Yelp check in offer of free dessert was happily honored with the choices of kheer (rice pudding), gulab jamun, or kulfi. All in all, Taj Mahal was a great option in an area unfamiliar to me and I would definitely return and recommend it to others. A bonus is that the restaurant is located in a vibrant and lively area with lots of shops to roam around in pre- or post-dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Saag Paneer
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior

iTUGXny2AuMmPkwQ3zhGsA.text: This is my favorite Indian restaurant to eat at in Phoenix!  My girlfriend and I come here every year to celebrate our anniversary and we have never once been disappointed with the service or food.  The owner is super funny and makes sure to speak to all his guest every time we go. He's even remembered us and where we have come from every time we come to eat (mind you, it's once a year!)     We will be back next year, thanks for the amazing food and hospitality.

Rs3y6BXOBZNF5Kq5U_Ln_w.text: I was in the mood for Indian so ordered delivery through yelp (and grubhub), this was my first time eating here and WOW did it not disappoint. I had that chicken tikka masala- DELISH- the garlic naan WOWW, like the Indian cousin to garlic bread. Rice was cooked perfectly, only thing I didn't really care for was the meat samosas, they weren't super crispy. But I would def recommend if in the mood!

4XHNUJDxkC3Yc7s8xlPkhw.text: Really good food and fast service when we came. The Chicken Saag and Tikka Masala were excellent. Will come again for sure.

Q0zZYkp3OS40QTMmrp3FpA.text: Great customer service. Great food- fresh. Beautiful restaurant. Manager was hilarious!

SI4kzO897mrSalZ7mceM4A.text: This place has the most average Indian food you could possibly find in a restaurant of this ambience. At first glance, the restaurant seems nice and you'd expect an above average dining experience (especially considering the price). However, everyone at our table felt pretty "meh" about our food.   The curries were alright. They're missing some staples from the menu like malai kofta. We got the eggplant curry and it just wasn't really prepared the way it normally should be. Others at our table got some chicken and lamb curries. Also our server forgot our order like three times. Why not write it down the first time and get it right?   The thing I had an issue with most was the naan. It was brittle and dry, as if it wasn't fresh, and it was almost to the point where it was too burnt to eat. Really not enjoyable. Also overpriced.   Here's the icing on the cake. They included tip in our bills without telling us, even though we were only a party of 4. Parties of 6+ I understand, but party of 4...? C'mon that's just cheating. We didn't realize this and ended up double tipping on the already overpriced meal.   Safe to say I won't be coming back. I'd give it 2 stars normally, but decided on 3 because not everyone's expectations for Indian food may be as high as mine.

7Ak3QuKEkBMIp1in0zhMKA.text: Do Not Order Take Out here.  I recently ordered dinner for delivery, which was an absolute rip off.  Here's a pic of what you get for $65.00.  Each "dinner size" portion is $17-$20, and about half the size of any standard entree.  It also does not come with rice or naan, which you have to buy separately.     Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.  I would never eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VyKnFA5JhE7-rIGaRSZ_VA.text: The food was scrumptious, chicken masala and garlic naan were the winners of our night but the drinks were just ok!

J35k2c8rAFxAS8FYuVq2Wg.text: Absolutely lovely spot -- some of the best Indian food I've had. The owner stopped by our table and gave us a nice chat about the history of the place and carefully suggested the heat level I should order. Will be coming back!

qzAmIdYs8r45FTeiH8pIMA.text: I love love Indian food! So went here on Saturday with a bunch of family and friends! The owner was down to earth! Our server was amazing! Sometimes i know dealing with a large party can be a tiring task; however he did great! I order the vegetarian mushroom dish and was amazing! Family order the famous tikka Marsala! My sister order the fish vilavadoo And said this was the best she has had! Guys trust me this little gem in Scottsdale is the place to try if you are craving Indian or you haven't tried it before!  They have a unique section of alcohol as well!  Will definitely be back in a few weeks

o10Kb8xrLfGpX3FhR1VmXQ.text: Love this place. Such rich and creamy food. Always the right spice level. The only reason I took a star off is because while I understand the plates with meat being expensive, but the vegetarian dishes almost cost at much as the meat :(. While this is not an everyday eatery because of the price, it certainly is a nice place for a good to-go treat!

YfaE8DvcDP1cp88EL10ssQ.text: So yesterday I was feeling very adventurous so I decided to try something new. Prior to my experience I've never had Indian food before. For a first experience it was amazing the waiter victor was very nice and had good conversation me and my GF loved him. Now for the food. It was like nothing I've ever tasted before I had the Paneer Masala 10/10, coconut vegetables 10/10, and the curry vegetables 10/10 rice pudding 10/10. I told victor that he will be seeing our faces once a week. The prices were fair, decor was amazing, and music was great

iKG2dQL0vwawoYrVY04pMg.text: Love to order take out from here! A little pricey but the garlic naan and the chicken tikka is so good!

u8eS6vqFmSJ41rZyziqLtA.text: A perfect evening ruined!!!!!  Went there to a paid party event but the owners of the restaurant came across extremely rude "guy last name Gill". Owners change there prices and rules/agreement in the middle of party which was not expected and unprofessional.  Will never consider this place for any future events and will never return!

0j6a4Ft0fuJZhnis9bfOGw.text: I really enjoyed the Rosemary Naan. It was light and toasted just right. My Lamb Curry was tender and the Medium Spice was perfect. Also you can't beat the Jasmine Rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Tikki Masala and Lamb Curry with Rosemary Naan!

o3mHNgMYBKLeG5nQJ2Tttg.text: I have been generally disappointed with the quality of Indian food in the Bay Area, so when we stumbled upon this place, we were in food heaven! This is our go-to Indian food place whenever we're visiting Scottsdale/Phoenix. The waitstaff is very friendly, and they are flexible with accommodating your dietary requests as well (more/less spicy, with/without add-ons, etc.). The owner/manager also helps run the restaurant by assisting with the orders, which is a great characteristic in my opinion. Our favorite dishes to get here are the paneer butter masala, dal tadka or dal makhani, and the garlic naan. Their mango lassi is also delicious. The ambiance is good too, although the cleanliness is average.

vkBbBo57opU5hc1efthGwQ.text: This is by far the best Indian restaurant in Scottsdale.  The food is oh my god incredible. And they will customize any dish you wish.  Really great friendly staff and a full bar.  This is a taste of Heaven.   Only issue is that I can't stop eating.  Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmy  Get your Indian fix here!!!!!!! Fabulousness!!!.

hinnoEPdFXk5bCs330kB9A.text: I was craving Indian food while in the Phoenix area for Spring Training . A quick Yelp search landed me here.   Located on a street with several other restaurants , bars and shop. Parking on both sides of the street can be tough depending on what time of day . I came on a weekend night and found a spot around the corner .   Inside was clean, spacious and low lit which was nice. It was not a busy night so I was seated right away.   Service was ok. Quick to give me the menu and take my drink order, however waited a decent amount of time to take my order. I was a little confused since it wasn't busy at all.   Eventually my order was taken. I was debating on the tikka masala or the coconut chicken. I went with the chicken tikka masala which comes with rice. I also got a free order of garlic naan upon check in!   Food arrived quickly and was so good ! Very filling and tasty. Great flavors! Price was decent too.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala and free Garlic Naan upon check in!

H78CpvcyAfyxc_0JMar-fA.text: I went here once previously and it was great. The second time around, completely opposite. Extremely slow service on a Saturday night and we arrived when the restaurant was almost empty. It took 45+ minutes to get our food. The waiter was inattentive and barely checked in to see how we were doing or how the food was. Food finally came out of the kitchen and it was sloppy. Won't be back! Not to mention, we were celebrating a birthday night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mushroom Mattar

hGXTUQy6u6uBCtJvEO1EwA.text: The chicken masala was the absolute best! Garlic Naan was also delicious. We drove over 45 minutes just to eat here again. Great atmosphere. Great service. We wonder why it's not busier. It was only half full, although then again we were eating a bit late. We absolutely love this place.

Nr2ZA92D60i1Wcu9i8PmLA.text: Taj Mahal exceeded our expectations! We are from out of town and brought our son to ASU. My husband and I have recently come to love Indian cuisine. I'm not one to write a review but we were so impressed we had dinner here twice in 3 days.  Freddie our waiter was extremely attentive. We especially loved the chicken tikka masala and saag paneer. The Naan was hot and the best we've had!  If this restaurant isn't busy when you go don't let it deter you. It's just a seasonal thing according to the owner.

fcdIZZiWsUTAIR6cIC7eYg.text: Presentation of food was awful in spite of just opening when we walked in. The buffet was half empty and it looked like the food had been sitting for while.  And the real kicker was it was $19.95. because it was Sunday. We decided to walk out. The best Indian restaurant is Indian Palace on 27th Avenue and Bell Road it's clean the people are there replenishing so  everything is hot. Owner should probably go over there and have a meal to see how nice the service and the presentation of fresh food is. Sadly people trying these particular buffets are turned off and that's why they say they don't like an Indian food

wKfGVAcMvOsrgzE8Cd9UCA.text: The food is wonderful. I always order the goat curry which has the best seasonings/sauce (order it hot!). The wife always gets the Butter Chicken. Bomb! Gil, the owner, is really nice and entertaining. Great place in Old Town for Indian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Garlic naan, butter chicken, and curry goat... Love!

hkVoedABHNDW6wuajm0GBg.text: Best atmosphere among Indian restaurants. Wonderful food. Owner Gil is fabulous and service is very good..

jAMnBhG7DZW6Qk65zk8WNg.text: Amazing amazing amazing. Had the chicken tikka masala, and it did not disappoint. Mango chutney would have made this place out of this world - but I'll settle for amazing.  We did have a bit of a wait for the food, but the staff was very apologetic and offered complimentary dessert.  Will return ASAP!

hehJ2dvCaumHNikBKtyaqg.text: A little pricey but the owner was nice and the food was great.   Like one of the previous post we were over charged by 25 dollars

hA6OBKzYSSRyN-XyMZtbNA.text: Taj Mahal has excellent food!  My husband and I love Indian food and have been looking for a restaurant in the Phoenix area!  Taj Mahal is by far the best in the valley!  Freddie, the server, was friendly and professional and the food was amazing!

uM5d5axMBw8URqs7qjXwtw.text: Great food and even better staff! A well rounded experience that keeps us coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Z9ixLO09tTS0zlF8nh6QeQ.text: Service was mediocre- food took more than an hour with our appetizers coming 30 mins later. It was strange, and when we finally got our food, it was bland and totally not worth the wait.   If the food was worth the wait, we would have given this place another star.  Maybe they are working out some kinks from being new. Hopefully things will get better. I would try them one more time in the hope that this was a one time fluke. If not, I would add them to my Indian restaurant reject list.  Wishing them the best.

k5exJqEZMJdDwc4WUouicA.text: All I can say is DELISH! Not only is the food amazing, the owner is hilarious and very friendly.   I highly recommend:  1. Onion, rosemary, cheese and garlic naan. All of them are tasty.  2. Chicken tikka from the tandoori menu. All breast meat that's juicy with great flavor.  3. Paneer masala- the flavors in this are unreal.  4. Chicken coconut- so creamy and flavorful 5. Chicken tikka masala- delicious!!  Oh man and the dessert pudding...just wonderful. This place is seriously a must!!

f-EPqRnPb4q3GcJ60j9_rA.text: The food is pretty good, at least for my staples like chicken tikka and chicken curry. I would order to go, but I don't really enjoy staying here to dine in. The owner is very friendly with the customers, but for one dining experience, I found him a bit intrusive and loud with our party. I felt like he was angry one minute and laughing the next, over and over again. On the other hand, another table he was chatting with before us seemed very happy to have him around, so I don't really know... I would get food to go if I were staying in Old Town, but I would spend as little time as possible in here.

NF4jcVF1swapgbRTGTywFA.text: Such amazing food! I haven't had Indian food in a long time and was a little nervous but wow, definitely my new go to. Great service, nice location, and AMAZING FOOD!

iSKJ_8NqRIHxAiCv5NsxYw.text: Service was awesome and personal. We were thankful they were open on Christmas Day. We come to the area every year and will be back for sure. Delicious. Best Indian we have had in all of Arizona!

XV-petmWNvNUQWuPCoUuWQ.text: Great Restaurant! I have been there several times and the food is delicious with amazing flavor. The service is always prompt and very friendly. Try it, you will love it!!

8L7Ht2nx-tcFIyLARDQxSA.text: Pro's: Amazing food. Came here 2x in the span of a week its that good. Food is 5 star.   Con's: A little on the expensive side and both times I've been here they've forgotten part of our order. Service is more like a 3.   The owner is very friendly and will come to your table to talk. It's nice at first but after the second time it can be a bit of an interruption.

PaYM2nK4QsLZvNrs-sXmEg.text: OK food. Loud Indian music videos with scantily clad women taking the attention away from our dinner.   Glass pints of water placed in front of our 2 & 4 yr olds...recipe for disaster.  Otherwise service was good.  Food slow to table.

Zrmfxf8ZlFKuf1N4sZa41g.text: Amazing!  We took friends who absolutely reject anything spicy, but, thanks to the server, Freddy, and the owner, they LOVED it!   We had four different main dishes, and three appetizers and all were fabulous.  You can easily choose the amount of spice you want, simply let the server know how much "heat"you like.   We definitely will return.

5Fh5qVFmbO9ft_73qPLKQQ.text: So my family and  I had a crazy experience at this establishment. It was my grandparents 60th anniversary. We arrived there by 6:30 and didn't get our food until 8 pm. The service staff(one who consisted of a young girl) had problems with simple things like serving everyone water. When my family told them about their bad service. The waitress freaked out and started yelling and then the owner was yelling. It was odd, it was like he was kicking us out but telling us he hoped we had a fun evening. Most of my family go outside and while we're outside we see my cousin get pushed out towards the door. Turns out our waitress decided to push him because she was upset about us complaining about her service. After that the restaurant tries to charge us on top off the discount they gave us. So my uncle's called the police...yeah suffice to say we won't be going to this restaurant again.

winslHVgLb-X_jWN8FwQWA.text: If I could rate this food any higher I would.  I'm so glad they opened in Scottsdale! My daughter and I have driven to the Prescott location from Peoria several times just for lunch.  Hands down the best Indian food in Az. It's a beautifully decorated space and they have an extensive menu as well as excellent service.  Go. Eat. Enjoy! They're the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. It&#39;s a na&#39;an kinda night. (Garlic na&#39;an, tikka masala, coconut curry fish, basmati rice)

R3rtozbamcyyuGkbLjJGFw.text: My husband and I recently moved here from Minneapolis. We were very sad to leave our constant go-to for Indian there (it's called Gandhi Mahal if you ever venture up to Minneapolis), and our expectations were very high moving down here. After trying a few places around the Tempe/Scottsdale/Paradise Valley and feeling pretty disappointed, I think we've finally found our go-to here at Taj Mahal.  We ordered take-out and got the chicken tikka masala, lamb boti masala, and a large rice. I was pretty surprised that the rice was extra, but figured the entrees wouldn't let us down, and they sure didn't. Both dishes were deliciously rich and creamy without being heavy. The flavor was incredible! The portions aren't huge, but we had plenty leftover for lunch the next day which was still outstandingly delicious.  While waiting for my order to be ready, I chatted with the owner who has a big personality and clearly knows how to treat customers right. He kindly threw in a complimentary naan bread and hot sauce on the side just for waiting a few extra minutes.  I do wish I could give 4.5 stars only because the naan was a little dry (maybe from it being take-out?) and the lamb was a little tough, but the flavor and customer service experience were both outstanding. We will definitely be back soon!

vxDzrFpp9i4RQXE95QlX3Q.text: This is a great authentic Indian restaurant! We were regular patrons for almost a year, until our hectic schedules took over and we eventually needed to revamp our eating habits to suit our lifestyle. The food is tasty, well-prepared and well-presented. You can't go wrong with any of the chicken dishes (we've tried them all!) The lassis are delicious and Gil, the owner, makes sure he sits down to chat with and check on every patron even on busy nights. He owns a sister location in Prescott.  The staff is absolutely on point on this place. Decor and ambiance is really nice, and we loved the added authenticity of viewing Bollywood music videos playing on the flat screens during dinner.   It's a great place to pop into after a long day of shopping up and down 5th Ave. as well as a great place to have a romantic date, a business lunch, or a drinks/appetizers meet-up spot with friends.   Gil takes care of his customers overall, but if you are a regular and there's mutual respect, you can expect a free drink or dessert on different occasions. Some may find Gil "rude" but we can assure you he's not. He's just a busy man with 2 restaurants he mostly runs himself and can appear to be in a rush. On slower days he will take the time to sit at your table to chat for 5-10 minutes. This may sound off-putting to some, but we actually really appreciated this gesture. He will memorize your favorite drinks/dishes and ask you if you'd like those very things the next time he sees you...even if months have gone by!

6aKBRq51W3bxwbT-dG9sjw.text: This is situated in the downtown Scottsdale area, so full of upscale people who eat out everyday  We were here on a Saturday evening for a family dinner. Ordered the Gobi Manchurian, The Vegetable platter, Roti, Naan, Veg Biryani, Raita, Dal Makhni, Paneer masala and the Saag bharta.  The appetizers were great and adequately spiced. They messed our Rotis up and put butter on them when we ordered with no butter. Due to this we had to wait for like 15mins before we could start eating the entrees and everything went cold. The folks were apologetic for this mess up and gave us some free rotis and a mango lassi. Not much they could have done I guess.  The food was delectable and presented well. The quantity could have been more considering the price.  Definitely recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area

oeZVBKNJ8lGUm5uXu1ys1Q.text: My family who has lived here for 22 years decided to take my relatives visiting from India here. We are all of Indian descent and have been to many Indian restaurants in our former home of Chicago, and without a doubt, our experience at this restaurant was abysmal.   We went on a Saturday for lunch and we were the only group in the entire restaurant. The servers were extremely friendly which is the only reason this has more than 1 star, but the tandoori chicken was undercooked on some pieces and clearly burnt on others. The Matar Paneer was decent, however, we had a terrible experience with the rest of the food. I hope this is an anomaly considering the other reviews, but other than the great service, the food was disappointing.

2CkZRIEAyNV2VYg3sEyLSA.text: We used to order from tandoori times which was great.  Since they closed we decided to try this.  We had chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, samosas, vegetable biryani and lamb korma.   The curries were okay.  Not great but okay.  Samosas were lacking.  The pastry was over salted and it was overly dry.  Naan was also dry- sort of stale tasting.  Biryani was also not great.    We won't order again.

yNuJETUDyEwyFGsg58Ngvw.text: I was visiting Arizona for the fitst time on a work trip and some co-workers and I stumbled upon this place. Of course I had to do a quick search on Yelp before we came in. At a quick glance I saw a 4 and a 1/2 star rating and 400+ reviews! Wow!! I immediately told my coworkers this is the place we're going to. I love Indian food and 4 and above stars is great!  Being that it's summer we notice that alot of places were empty but we were told that during the summer this is how it is here. It wasn't a reflection of the business itself so quickly glancing at the menu I knew I wanted the chicken massala. I was so pleased with my choice. I tried the garlic naan and rice which is enough to share.  So let me tell you how good this place is. I came back the next day with my coworker. This time, I tried the butter chicken as recommended by Gil, the owner. He's very friendly and his passion for this place is evident.   I didn't end up loving the butter chicken as much as I did the chicken massala, but it was still very tasty and probably some of the best Indian food I've had in a long time.  I highly recommend this place if you're visiting the Scottsdale/Old Towne area.   I can't say I'm in a huge rush to come back to Scottsdale or Arizona, but if I'm ever in this area again I definitely coming to the Taj Mahal.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bOVLD2HRrNfRz4bS7u5OJw.text: If you like Indian food, you will be thrilled here!  We were served a large bowl of rice and the two separate dishes.   It was easy to share and sample two different entrees.   We both agreed that the signature dish of chicken tikki masala is, "The Signature Dish!" Hector was exceptional and it was a delightful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Plain Naan bread and hot sauce.
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Tikki Massa and Chicken Vegetable Curry.
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bar with $2 off everything for Happy Hour.

fKL53VHgRDav59d65cjcKw.text: Haven't had Indian food in years, but this place brought back memories of a friend's family's home cooking.   The menu is pretty expansive with many vegetarian, vegan and pescetarian options.  You can chose your own spice level which is ideal (it is more conservative spicy so you can turn it up a notch). Portions were generous. We left quite full and had leftovers of everything.  The space was modern and open. There was not an overwhelming smell of spices. Full bar and happy hour available.   Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   I'm honestly pretty excited to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dinner spread.
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Date night

FsG5tJJf0SG9IB-QYYmycQ.text: Their butter chicken is really good. I've only ordered takeout and sometimes the food quality varies but overall a good place for Indian food.

1WBPjulDPk3GwYrH5eejVg.text: Omg I forgot about this spot!(yes I am kicking myself) if your a foodie and love going out of the box hit this place up! The naan was not to heavy and the rice was cooked to perfection now let's talk the chicken tikka masala we order the mild to medium it had excellent flavor and perfect for someone who does not handle spice well...  oh yes the service was excellent. let's say you will find me as regular.......I haven't even paid my bill  and I am already to come back!

pASWeUyd-LIHc3qnZOl05g.text: Maybe my expectations for Indian food are too high, but this place didn't leave me craving to come back to this place. The decor in the inside is pretty nice, and it is in a good location in Old Town, but the food and service itself was subpar.  We ordered the naan and an eggplant curry. The eggplant curry was alright, a little closer to what it should taste like but not quite the authentic feel. It did have a nice kick to it from the spice, but had a bit of a raw eggplant taste to it. The naan looked good but tasted bad, as it almost felt like I was eating wafers or something instead of naan. Naan is supposed to be soft and fluffy while being somewhat thin, but this naan is more on the crispy side and way too thin. And on top of that it is so expensive for what you get...  I come from eating Indian food in California and the East Coast, so maybe Indian food here has lower standards. But I am rating this place based on how it tastes, and this is honestly how I feel about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Garlic naan with eggplant curry

Z6eOIjgum2DXVLYQm-LkvQ.text: My friends and I stopped in Taj Majal for dinner and we were pleasantly surprised. We ordered all vegan dishes:  Mattar Bhartha Chana Masala Punjabi Dhal  The bhartha was the favorite, which was no surprise to me because I love eggplant dishes. I wish it had been a little more spicy, but the flavors were bright and delicious.   We also ordered rosemary naan and basmati rice, and my friends enjoyed a chai tea and a glass of wine.   The flavors of all of the dishes blended so well together, and I thoroughly enjoyed my leftovers the next day!  I'm glad to know Taj Majal is close by and I'd come back for dine in or takeout :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PWzAFGe7SdrjJILv-BI7Fg.text: Went for the 4.5 star rating, was not disappointed!  Ordered the lamb korma which was fantastic.  Compared to Indian restaurants in the Midwest and on the East coast, this lamb was very high quality and very tender.  Seasoning was delicious, on par with several other authentic Indian locales I've visited and thoroughly enjoyed.  They do have a full bar which I took advantage of.  Happy to report that the mixed drinks are not watered down.  At $12 per, my two drinks cost more than the food, but... alcohol is optional.  Received service, in part, from one of the owners who was friendly and accommodating.  Always nice to see the owners personally invested in their business and interacting with their customers.  My one and only moment of hesitation was on hearing that rice does not come with the main dish.  But on obtaining the bill, my opinion is that a large bowl of rice is both economically viable and highly recommended.

9mPC-Qk92PuD7RQ6BpXnLA.text: Best Indian we've found in Scottsdale. Everything was amazing especially the Lamb Vindaloo. Great, very friendly service. They go the extra mile to make sure you have a great experience here. This is now my go to Indian in Scottsdale!

_I5AVfCIvoVgS5J7olaBtA.text: I never wrote a bad review, but this place SUCKS. Please, save ur night and don't go there.. Food was below average, I ordered Beryani ( Way below average, literally rice and chicken with no flavor) Tikka Masalla (Average) and an eggplants dish that tasted awful. They were extremely over priced ( 3 dishes for $102) they also trick you with adding the gratitude (20%) to the bill and leave another blank space for the tip. Service was really bad, food take forever to come. And wait, their portion size is kids size..   Don't let the fake reviews to fool you.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qkhSupoR6Ki6vs5MVMLIIA.text: My wife and I have been bringing friends here for quite some time now and everyone has loved it. The staff is extremely friendly and the food continues to be fantastic.   For vegetarians and vegans, I HIGHLY recommend the Coconut Veggie with medium spice. If you want more protein, ask them to add garbanzos to it.   During certain times of the year, they offer a Thali Platter during lunch. It's definitely the way to go. It includes two entrees, spinach, lentils, and naan bread. I'm salivating just thinking about it! I guess I may have to go for lunch today.

4b5Fo2nmMX_BWZWO9DEwYg.text: I haven't had better Indian Cuisine in Phoenix.  The restaurant was relatively empty so we may have been the recipient of concentrated attention.  Nonetheless, the food was prepared remarkably well and delivered in a timely manner.  We will return at a busier time to see if the taste and service are repeatable or we caught lightning in a bottle

d0KatAUaEuRAOYxesXIYnQ.text: This place is amazing. You won't find better Indian food around. I have tried a few items on the menu but I always come back to the Mushroom Bhaji. The Lamb Boti Kabob is fantastic as well. The owner and service are just great. Don't forget the Garlic Naan!

rL2JOVJYc-x8qW_-zeG3nw.text: Excellent Indian food. Very good service. Nice atmosphere. Not sure what keeps me from giving it a 5-star rating but there is just something about it that falls a little short of a top rating. The serving sizes are a little on the small size and the prices are on the high side. But all and all a very good place to try if you enjoy Indian Food.

Ct3BaPYkKS7GNmFE0FlU-g.text: As a disclaimer, this review is based on delivery fulfilled by Grubhub and not eating at the actual restaurant. In any case the food was very subpar and overpriced. Avoid at all costs.  Being that this is Scottsdale I expect food to be expensive, which is fine if it's good. Not the case at Taj Mahal. First, I ordered the Taj Naan ($6.99) which was described as naan stuffed with tandoori chicken and onions. What I actually received were a few pieces of soggy hot-pocketish bread stuffed with very fine meat with little flavor. The bigger fail was the lamb vindaloo I ordered at the price of (gasp) $18.99. While the vindaloo had a good spicy flavor, the portion size was ridiculous for the price...a small styrofoam container with probably only four chunks of lamb and a few potatoes. While spicy, it was way greasier than most vindaloos I've had in the past. Additionally, no complementary rice or naan were included for that exorbitant price.   To top it all off and add to insult to injury, the delivery bag had no utensils or napkins. Kind of makes it difficult to eat when you're in a hotel room.  I'm still a big fan of Grubhub delivery and have had some amazing experiences, more so in bigger, better food cities such as New York and Los Angeles. Unfortunately Taj Mahal was a fail and as a result I will most definitely never patronize the brick and mortar restaurant.

3cgq6Ai20ziJEl3PrTjitw.text: I ordered this through Grubhub just now, and at over $17 for a chicken dish, and they can't even include rice??? It was $40 for one tiny meal that had no rice, the garlic naan that was completely black and burned, the raita was just some kind of really watery liquid with nothing in it that had some "off" tasting flavor and was inedible (whatever it was, it was not raita), and they couldn't include utensils.  I had to go to the store to get some rice to make, which completely defeated the purpose of ordering from this place.  What a rip off!! This place is doing it all wrong...They very clearly do not care about their customers or the quality of food they are putting out!

UW5yJrWLT3_mH2zWcuyy_w.text: I honestly thought twice about writing this review because I was worried our hidden gem of a restaurant would become too crowded!   This is the first Indian restaurant I've ever been to where the chef came out to discuss our dinner order to make sure it was perfect! The atmosphere was relaxing and the drinks amazing! I would highly recommend this...we will definitely be back.

gJKALCFdrVatwDBun_ha7g.text: I was craving some Indian food and decided to grab takeout from here.  Could not decide between Chicken Makhani and Butter Chicken (I always thought they were the same thing?), so I ordered both!  And, so glad that I did!  It was just what my body was craving after a night of adult beverages ;)

kWfcN0StxvBfXvu_77mAQA.text: What a great experience I had! All from just a simple order out. I think my guy was named Ruben, not sure but he was AMAZING.  My pick up person was running late and he called to make sure they were coming and even made sure to send my food back to the kitchen to make sure it was hot when I received it.  I ordered Lamb Biriyani and it was really tasty!  Love this place :) home away from home.

v4yST9fTTm40uNa5mMIBgQ.text: We have been to so many Indian Cuisines and this one is the BEST over all! Food is booming with flavor and the employees are grade A with customer service! Definitely coming back here again!

UFvfhTqMLww6ptVoO_ndFw.text: Great menu and very flavorful plate. Recommend choosing the lamb thali. It is a great way to try multiple dishes for a good price.

NpwHKc_7FTnsnsPrsD9WNg.text: Absolutely amazing! The lamb Samosas and chicken Pakora were the best we've tasted! The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the owner recognized me from my last visit over a year ago! Great ambiance and service!

ogaFHdqvm6gOWR4cnaEMlA.text: This is a hidden gem in Scottsdale. Great food and hands down the best location for getting Indian food in the valley. Got a chance to speak to the owner too. Really nice guy and took care of us the whole time. Highly recommend this place.

scNY3M2hsqIfqyoJrwX4VA.text: This is the absolutely best Indian food I have had outside of London, ( I have not been to India). The staff is wonderful, accomodating, and friendly; the quality of food is superb. I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.

5hQClQU5yhKDNyAHBq5lag.text: I love the decor inside the plane and the owner was incredibly friendly, I just wasn't too impressed with the food. I will go back to give it one more try.

Ta25wb-STSYOi59Z7sal0A.text: Love this place.  Great food. I discovered it about a month ago and have cravings for it almost everyday.  Try the lamb bhuna and the chicken tikka masala.  Both are excellent.  Their naan bread is the best I've had.   The owner is a real character. Nice man who genuinely cares about his customers having a wonderful meal and experience.    I'm definitely a fan.

jwwzfZgFAOXn2JIxBjNOCg.text: Probably the best Indian food I have ever had !!! What impressed me was the quality of the food. There are No short cuts here! So you do pay a bit more, but the quality is evident. The sauces were excellent as were the taste of the chicken and the lamb !!! They ask you how spicy you would like and they were spot on !! They also had serrano pepper naan!! I have never seen this naan any where and probably one of the naan I have ever had !! Service was excellent too !!! When in town again I will always come back!!! Did take some left overs and heated them the next day, just as good !!! A True sign of the quality of the food !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Naan with serrano pepper in it !!! Best ever !!!
Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Our excellent food!!!

plBQUzW1QWsDzN8s9Phcsg.text: Went  as a group of 7 and ordered appetizers samosas, tandoori fish, tandoori pakoras, and chicken tikka. All the appetizers were pretty greasy and sub standard. We decided to skip dinner and go to another place for dinner based on the appetizer quality.

NaaKYWDGfqKnDztw2CU0LQ.text: This is a great place. We originally went to try their lunch buffet. Unfortunately for us, the buffet was suspended until the fall. But we stayed and tried the chicken Marsala and Bhuna.   The service was fantastic. The decor subdued yet tasteful. And of course, the food was fresh and delicious. Sometimes, when you go to a restaurant in a touristy area, the food would be less authentic and drier. But to our wonderful surprise it was delicious.   In context, my husband and I have tried our shares of Indian food from London to Boston to the Berkshires. So, we can honestly say Taj of Scottsdale is one of the best.

ZfvN9gkk-Wp7fzJHozb_aw.text: Average Food. Loud, Unprofessional & Brash Host  This place is highly rated and that is what drew me  and my friends here on Christmas Day. Here's what happened. This might be hard to believe but its True. I'm not a fan of writing lengthy negative yelp reviews.  1. Host (heavy set Indian Punjabi guy) comes to take the order, writes all the items. We ordered a range of items from lamb, chicken, biriyani and pulao. Host asks for spice level.. My friend asks host if he is asking for any specific item, Host responds that he's referring to "everything" (At this point my friend and rest of us didnt like his tone) and not just one item. So we told him mild.. Till now everything was fine.   2. During the course of our meal, he came up to our table 3 times asking the exact same questions(trying to make conversation)  a. how the food was(which was fine by us) b. how he is seeing so many people from california today visiting his restaurant  c. tried to "settle" things with my friend that if they were "good" 3. On the last two of the three occasions, he jokingly taunted my friend by telling my friend's wife "she is with this man". Even tried making a funny comment at his daughter. He jokingly asked us if we had been "driven out of California that we were at that restaurant ". When we asked for the check he also said we could leave pay a couple of thousand dollars to which my friends wife said that he could give us a complementary meal. Following it he again mocked us. I don't think any sane host ever behaves like this 4. He was rude to his staff (seemed mostly mexican) including yelling at them, talking to them in an undignified tone. He was also talking in a boisterous manner even with other customers trying to please them. Has no sense of customer service or class whatsoever.  5. During the "driven out of California" comment I lost my cool and told him that we werent interested in making conversation with him and needed to get the check. As he walked away he said in a snide manner that "It was my lucky day that he fed me".  6. He yelled at the waiter again asking them to ring us up and gave a paper check with extremely poor handwriting and added a 20%+ tip(87 dollars was inflated to 106). In order to avoid any further altercation, we just paid everything off and left.  By far the most uncultured unprofessional host i have seen till date. Owner: if you're reading this, please take note and fire him because of the way he behaves with your staff if not anything else. Host: If you happen to be the owner, may god save you and go learn the basics of customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Taj Mahal - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Read my review on 12/25/2016 Owner charged a tip of more than 20% for a party of four inspite of shitty service and gave a paper receipt

PZ_R8fIT_ieL2ubkz4eaJw.text: It might just be me, but if you're one of three tables in a large restaurant and you've waited for 10mins for someone to ask if you'd like a drink - it's time to go. They may have decent food, but you're rolling the dice on whether you'll wait to eat. I'm currently writing this review from the Jewel of the Crown, eating.

BB72dwatvT_LmVmHxwAFpQ.text: Forth time at this great little casual Indian restaurant!  The food was awesome, atmosphere comfortable and service was warm and friendly! Have never been disappointed.  My husband is gluten free.  Previously they had no GF beer on hand.  Tonight, however, they were prepared for us!  The wine selection is ok, but the meals are always outstanding!

UvC8NLaxWRNn-UaN16XCSg.text: The food is always delicious. The vegetable koroma has lots of vegetables and the raisins add a touch of sweetness and the almonds add a nice texture to dish. The naan comes out piping hot and so yummy. Make sure to try their chai tea! They brew the tea to order so it does take a few moments.
